column1: (a)  The said judgment is contrary to law and against the weight of evidence.
(b)  The learned District Judge misdirected himself on the facts in determining that all parties
admitted that Daniel was the original owner of the land sought to be partitioned. It was
admitted by the parties other than, the 1st,2nd,16th 18th and 19th defendants.
(c)  The  learned  District  Judge  has  failed  to  give  any  reason  for  determining  lots  1  to  13
constitute the entire corpus sought to be partitioned.
(d)  the learned District Judge has failed to give reasons for accepting the evidence of the 15th
(e)  The learned District Judge has not considered whether the possession of Lot 1 by the 16th
defendant  and  the  19th  defendant  amounts  to  adverse  possession  and  no  reasons
whatsoever as to determining that the appellant has not proved that he and his father's
